author: sky.cactus
content: Do we have evidence that miners were censoring transactions at scale prior to the introduction of Flashbots/MEV Boost?  Part of me wonders if this is one of those situations where if the default tools don't censor, most people won't censor and it is only a problem when someone goes out of their way to build censorship into default/popular/common tooling that we have a problem.

author: sky.cactus
content: If we move to ePBS and get rid of Flashbots/MEVBoost, and ePBS and all of the Ethereum clients *don't* censor, will perhaps we see the censorship just stop on its own?

author: sky.cactus
content: Maybe the solution to censorship resistance is as simple as making the best tools available not censor by default, and very few people will go out of their way to build and advertise censorious software.

author: sky.cactus
content: If so, perhaps we should focus on ePBS first and ILs only if we see censorship continue afterwards?

author: potuz
content: I mostly agree with the above, and that's one of the reasons I push for ePBS as a bug fix, not trying to find the ultimate design while leaving the status quo entrench itself for years. However, in regards to censoring, I believe that by moving to a "sane default" we will avoid most of the censoring of txs like those from tornado cash or OFAC listed addresses, we will still need to deal separately with focused censoring like a optimistic rollup operator trying to rug the L2 by censoring the fraud proof mechanism, or a trader trying to do a toxic arbitrage on a ZK rollup delaying by censoring the batch poster

If you are a validator today, that wants to propose blocks such that

content: yeah, but in systems where the builder needs to be collateralized to pay for the bid, then a validator will either forfeit large blocks and construct locally, or will have to allow someone else to sign their blocks. If all blocks are valuable, you completely leave censor resistance to the builders which is a centralized set. ILs are not bullet proof, but are much more effective in guaranteeing inclusion

author: potuz
content: It may be, it may be that anyway block production becomes impossible on regular hardware, the only point of ePBS is to let builders and proposers transact without any trusted intermediary. This enables proposers to choose their own builder (something they can't today) and enables builders to advertise directly. We are seeing crazy games played by relays in which they lower the bid offered to the validator to pay back the builder... we are enabling these games... but anyway, this has nothing to do with the topic of this channel
